ai-patthana15.2:0.2_0: The Order of the Dhamma: allows unintelligent in the Khadehaka, that is to say, the Lord of the Death,
ai-patthana15.2:1.1_0: For it is in causal relation to the teaching associated with pleasant feeling, and doesn’t give rise to pleasant feeling.
ai-patthana15.2:2.1_0: You shouldn’t give rise to pleasant feeling with painful feeling, without a reason,
ai-patthana15.2:3.1_0: For it is not possible for the pleasant feeling to give up feeling to painful feeling, and not with a reason to give rise to pleasant feeling.
ai-patthana15.2:3.1_1: This is the section in brief.
ai-patthana15.2:5.1_0: And the same answers to the same.
ai-patthana15.2:6.1_0: For it is in causal relation to painful feeling, not associated with painful feeling, and doesn’t give rise to the cause or condition.
ai-patthana15.2:6.1_1: This is the section in brief.
ai-patthana15.2:7.1_0: ‘... for the sake of all three things.’
ai-patthana15.2:8.1_0: For it is not associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling to the teaching. Painful feeling does not give rise to pleasant feeling.
ai-patthana15.2:8.1_1: This is the section in brief.
ai-patthana15.2:9.1_0: ‘... for the sake of all three things.’
